Dead by daylight is a well made game with so many details and mechanics that leaves it a great and fun game, the only problem is the people playing it. I play this game, and I probably will for quite a while more. but i cannot in any way recommend anyone in any doubt to pick this game up. This is the most toxic and horribly community I have experienced, much less heard off. It makes LoL players seem as nice as Mr. Rogers.

So unless you are a masochist, or have the most patience in the world, or like me have evil friends that trick you into having fun and coming back to this torture machine of a game. Stay very very far from this game.

Type of Game:
PVP aysmmertrical hide and seek mutant

Music:
Good

Gameplay:
Simple to pick up, but hard to master.

Grind:
Boat loads of grind.

Replayability:
Literally next to infinite

Story:
Plenty of lore and a mild amount of cutscenes.

Summary:
Very fun and unique type of hide and seek/horrorish/casual/intense game. It has had it's fair share of problems with the devs not listening before, but with the 6th anniversary, the balancing of the game may get better. Plus cakes are nice in this game. If you want a unique gaming experience and don't mind some pvp toxicity, than come on down and play.

worst yet most addicting game I have every played. it will make you lose all faith in humanity, not worth buying if you value your sanity and/or time. if you are looking for a horror game look elsewhere, this game is mildly scary the first few games you play...then it becomes more of a competitive game. if you have friends that are willing to play it with you then its fun sometimes, but if you would be playing solo for the most part...lets just say it is the worst experience you will ever endure.

Ok so first of all this game is ass. but i still love it. i have over 300 hours on xbox and i just moved to pc but as a quick review. its fun for a bit but if someone camps youll not have any fun. updates that really make a difference are few and far between and bugs take a while to get fixed. when content does come out its usually pretty fun but also slightly frustrating on the survivor side. some tips are dont use NOED or you might get death threats. never use more than one exastion perk. and dont 360 unless your good or your in bot lobies. some slang: NOED is talking about the ability no one escapes death. looping is when the killer is chasing you and your taking them through a course of window vaults and pallets. Shack or killer shack is refering to the hut/building where there are 2 doorways and one window to vault through.Basement is the area that spawns in a random area(mostly inside a building) where you can go down stairs and four unbreakable hooks spawn. it will also have lockers and one chest. Sandbaging is when you intentionally or not lead the killer to a seperate survivor when your getting chased. With this knowlage you still may not have fun. overall i recomend giving it a try if you have money to share

Где-то в глубинах Behavior interactive.
-Милорд, у нас кончаются деньги.
-Надо что-то сделать. Какие будут ваши предложения?
-Давайте исправим баланс?
-Чушь какая, ведь сейчас и так всегда побеждают сурвы, давай дальше.
-Может исправим бесконечные баги?
-Какие баги, "искреннее удивление", у нас нет в игре багов.
-Давайте хотя бы запретим русским покупать нашу игру.
-Хорошо придумано, займитесь этим немедленно, но этого мало, нужно что-то еще.
-А давайте сделаем из Девида Кинга 3,14ИД@РАСА...

I'm torn on how to rate this game, because I liked playing it, but the game feels ruined.
Dead by Daylight lost the majority of it's horror aspect a while ago and that's why i stopped playing. It just becomes a tactical 4v1 where each team gets carried by the perks they choose. Despite the survivor's inability to fight back, the resources they have significantly outweigh those of the killer, and it feels that no matter what you do, going into a game will feel unbalanced.
I do, however, like the complexity of perks and especially killers. If the perks in the game were more in line with one another instead of varying in usefulness wildly, then it would be more entertaining to play both sides. Very few killers feel awful to play, and there are so many that every play style is covered.

I still don't recommend DBD. I've spent hundreds of hours playing it and most were spent frustrated because of poor game design.
